texts.value: G-protein coupled receptor for 5-hydroxytryptamine (serotonin), a biogenic hormone that functions as a neurotransmitter, a hormone and a mitogen (PubMed:35714614, PubMed:8226867). Ligand binding causes a conformation change that triggers signaling via guanine nucleotide-binding proteins (G proteins) and modulates the activity of downstream effectors (PubMed:35714614, PubMed:8226867). HTR7 is coupled to G(s) G alpha proteins and mediates activation of adenylate cyclase activity (PubMed:35714614)
Isoform A and isoform B appear to be expressed at higher levels.
Predominant isoform in spleen, caudate and hippocampus
Minor isoform in terms of expression
Specificity for G(s) G alpha proteins is determined by the length of transmembrane regions 5 and 6 (TM5 and TM6)
Belongs to the G-protein coupled receptor 1 family
